item.title: 10 Marvel Characters Who Are Perfect For A Horror Game
item.description:
Summary

  • Marvel has dark characters that could thrive in horror video games
  • Characters like Morbius and Man-Thing have sinister potential
  • By tapping into horror genres, Marvel can unlock new gaming success.

The Marvel Universe is home to some of the most iconic and diverse characters in all fiction. The heroes and villains fans have come to adore range from realistic and relatable to idealistic personifications of morals and societal values. But even in a world full of campy heroes and wholesome altruists, Marvel has a gallery of macabre and sinister characters that have a strong following.

As Marvel continues to expand its video game empire, it may be worth placing some of these darker characters into a genre the media juggernaut has seldom explored: horror. With the right characters, gameplay, and storylines in mind, players may be inclined to pick up a horror title with the famed red-and-white logo on the front cover, bringing the entertainment company a new avenue of success in the gaming industry.

10 Morbius

The Living Vampire

  • Creators: Roy Thomas and Gil Kane
  • Comic Debut: Amazing Spider-Man #101 (1971)

After experimenting on himself with vampire bats to cure his rare blood disease, Dr. Michael Morbius became a pseudo-vampire with an insatiable bloodlust. Now fighting his predatory instincts with a desire to do good and find a cure for his condition, Morbius struggles to maintain his humanity as a living vampire.

Morbius' vampiric ties make him a perfect candidate for a horror game. Players can flip the script of traditional stealth horror games by playing as the cursed anti-hero. Think Dead by Daylight , but with a single-player twist and always playing as the killer. Given the recurring theme of mental health in Morbius' writing, Marvel has a great opportunity to balance brutal, suspenseful gameplay with an emotionally charged story.

9 Man-Thing

An Experiment Gone Wrong

  • Creators: Stan Lee, Roy Thomas, Steve Gerber, Gerry Conway, Gray Morrow
  • Comic Debut: Savage Tales #1 (1971)

Dr. Theodore Sallis was a brilliant biochemist and professor who strove to make the next Super Soldier Serum. After injecting himself with the serum and getting into a car crash in The Everglades, Sallis transformed into Man-Thing, a terrifying creature with the appearance of the swamp's flora.

Man-Thing's nature abilities are perfect for players to terrorize enemies. The game will be set in the swamp, a unique horror game setting. Few things sound more terrifying than a seven-foot-tall plant monster rising out of a swamp and dragging someone down with it.

8 Doctor Strange

Oftentimes Lives Up To His Name

  • Creators: Stan Lee, Steve Ditko
  • Comic Debut: Strange Tales #110 (1963)

Neurosurgeon Dr. Stephen Strange's life changed when he was in a car accident, which maimed his hands. He sought out a powerful sorcerer known as The Ancient One, who healed his hands and taught him the Mystic Arts. Stephen pursued the study of magic and now resides in New York City, where he serves as a guardian against mystical forces.

While Dr. Strange himself is not a terrifying creature, the Sorcerer Supreme battles against various hideous monsters, the dead, and dark magic users. Monster horror games are popular, so being able to cast mystical spells to slay ferocious beasts sounds like an enticing adventure that's sure to feature thrilling jumpscares and excellent combat mechanics.

7 Werewolf By Night

A Beast In The Moonlight

  • Creators: Roy Thomas, Jean Thomas, Gerry Conway, Mike Ploog
  • Comic Debut: Marvel Spotlight #2

After Dracula slayed his wife, vengeful Transylvanian scholar Baron Grigory Russoff became a werewolf after being bitten by one under Dracula's employ. Since then, a curse of lycanthropy has been passed down to each of Grigory's descendants through numerous magical means. But, no matter the means of gaining the curse, each member of the Russoff family now has no choice but to become a werewolf any time there is a full moon.

Marvel has the option to make a series of Werewolf By Night games that focus on a single generation and a family member in each game. In addition, the writers have the opportunity to use the broken family trope for the games, creating a franchise that is equally scary and emotional.

6 Gorr The God Butcher

Driven By Revenge

  • Creators: Jason Aaron, Esad Ribic
  • Comic Debut: Thor: God of Thunder #2 (2012)

After losing his entire family to the harsh conditions of his planet, Gorr believed that the gods had forsaken him. Seeking vengeance for what he lost, Gorr armed himself with All-Black The Necrosword, one of Marvel's most powerful weapons, and began to kill every god he could find, becoming the "God Butcher".

Gorr would be a perfect candidate for a horror game with similar mechanics and storyline to the God of War franchise. There would be many great opportunities for brutal kills and terrifying cutscenes to make players feel like a boogieman that even the gods cower before.

5 Moon Knight

The Fist Of Khonshu

  • Creators: Doug Moench, Don Perlin
  • Comic Debut: Werewolf By Night #32 (1975)

After being left for dead in Egypt, mercenary Marc Spector was given a second chance at life by the moon god, Khonshu, who revived him. Spector took an oath to be his fist and protect nighttime travelers with his brand of violent justice. In his youth, Spector developed dissociative identity disorder, something that became a major point of emphasis in all of his media appearances.

The dark and gritty vigilante battles many mythological-themed villains and monsters, perfect for an action-horror game. In addition, the writers could emphasize mental health with Spector's different personalities and the toll serving Khonshu has on his mind.

4 Scarlet Witch

Connected To Chaos

  • Creators: Stan Lee, Jack Kirby
  • Comic Debut: X-Men #4 (1964)

Throughout her youth, Wanda discovered she could harness chaos magic and manipulate probability and reality. Through many teachers, Wanda grew her skills and learned how to harness her powers, but has frequently wrestled with the effects her magic has on her mind.

Wanda Maximoff's chaos powers are dangerous, as, with them, she has eradicated races and timelines. A psychological horror game would suit the Scarlet Witch as she struggles to use her powers while trying to resist the corrupting nature of her powers.

3 Ghost Rider

The Spirit Of Vengeance

  • Creators: Gary Friederich, Mike Ploog
  • Comic Debut: Marvel Spotlight #5 (1972)

Though many have adopted the Ghost Rider name, the Spirit of Vengeance exists to punish those who have wronged others and bring them to the demon, Mephisto, for punishment. But typically, those who are contracted to be the Ghost Rider are actively trying to escape Mephisto's deal, providing an interesting struggle between the two forces.

With his connections to demons, the ability to sling hellfire at foes, and a hellish landscape, Ghost Rider could easily star in a game similar to Doom with a hack-and-slash and horror twist.

2 Magik

The Queen Of Limbo

  • Creators: Len Wein, Dave Cockrum
  • Comic Debut: Giant-Size X-Men #1 (1975)

lllyana Rasputina was abducted into the demonic realm Limbo at age six. Though on earth she was only gone for a few seconds, Illyana was abused in Limbo for years, but managed to learn powerful dark magic to become the queen of the realm and escape as a teenager. Unfortunately, these experiences led her to sustain large amounts of trauma.

Marvel could balance demonic and psychological horror to show Illyana fighting literal and mental demons in Limbo. The game would benefit from a similar playstyle to Hades, where she must escape the dark world by fighting challenging bosses and respawn at the start after defeat.

1 Elsa Bloodstone

The Ultimate Monster Hunter

  • Creators: Dan Abnett, Michael Lopez
  • Comic Debut: Bloodstone #1 (2001)

Elsa was born into the monster-hunting business, as her father, the legendary Ulysses Bloodstone, forced her to fight monsters since her infancy. Despite his cruel methods, Elsa willingly followed in his footsteps to become a legendary monster hunter.

Elsa has seen her fair share of horrors in her lifetime, all in the form of disturbing creatures that she has conquered. Marvel could send players on a globetrotting journey as Elsa through dark worlds where monsters are waiting in the shadows, creating the perfect, intense horror game.

item.title: 8 Best Horror Games With Multiple Protagonists
item.description:
Summary

  • Horror games with compelling narratives from multiple perspectives can make for lasting and engaging experiences.
  • Some horror games focus on storytelling through dynamic character perspectives and shifts.
  • Gamers can engage with an array of characters in certain horror titles for diverse gameplay experiences.

Horror gaming can offer memorable and impactful experiences if those playing manage to resonate with the themes and gameplay that the titles are trying to convey. Sadly, it's easy for games in this genre to rely more on shock value instead of a thought-provoking experience.

So, when certain horror titles manage to tell a great story, they become all the more notable. This is especially true in the case of scary games with ambitious stories that are told via multiple protagonists.

8 Mouthwashing

A Nonlinear Narrative That Focuses On The PoV Of Two Different Characters

6 Images
6 Images
Mouthwashing
9.0 /10
Released
September 26, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Despite being an experience that will take less than three hours for most players, Mouthwashing 's impact lasts way, way longer than that. The story of a crew stranded in space after a crash makes for a nerve-racking time, especially when more information comes to light.

Players control Jimmy after the crash and Curly before it. This PoV shift makes for a fun twist later down the line as certain actions are contextualized, and a seemingly normal character turns into one of the most terrible people to ever exist.

7 Eternal Darkness: Sanity's Requiem

A Mind-Bending Narrative Featuring Multiple Playable Characters

6 Images
6 Images
Eternal Darkness: Sanitys Requiem
10.0 /10
Released
June 24, 2002

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence
Powered by

Technically speaking, players control Alex for the bulk of the adventure in Eternal Darkness: Sanity's Requiem . However, while learning about a story that spans multiple lifetimes, the game shifts the PoV to other relevant characters.

It's a simple and engaging way to tell a story that spans multiple eras, hammering in the all-reaching threat of a powerful ancient evil that threatens to destroy the world. The cycling protagonists ensure that Eternal Darkness will grab a player's attention and keep them occupied for hours on end.

6 Alan Wake 2

Both Alan And Saga Star In Their Respective Chapters

Alan Wake 2
5 /10
27
8.4 /10
Released
October 27, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language
Powered by

Alan Wake 2 is one of the greatest survival horror games that fans of the genre can check out, with the sheer love put into this title making it clear why video game auteurs are more necessary than ever. This bizarre video game can feel downright surreal at times, yet this doesn't detract from the amazing story it wants to convey.

It helps that both Alan and Saga are great protagonists to control in their respective adventures. Dealing with the Taken using firearms and a trusty flashlight makes for pulse-pounding gameplay as both lead characters do everything in their power to survive.

5 Resident Evil 2

Leon S. Kennedy, Claire Redfield, Ada Wong, And Chris Redfield Are All Playable

5 Images
5 Images
Resident Evil 2
20
9.1 /10
Released
January 25, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Intense Violence
Powered by

Resident Evil 2 is an iconic entry in the RE series, and countless fans were glad to see the remake do justice to the original title's legacy. As one would expect from this series, the narrative is quite complicated and told via multiple PoVs, encouraging players to clock in multiple playthroughs.

After completing the Leon and Claire campaigns, the game surprises players by introducing two new characters to the fray. Both Ada Wong and Chris Redfield are compelling figures in their own right and make for a fun treat to control after players assume that they've seen everything this title has to offer.

4 Until Dawn

Players Control The Actions Of Multiple Teenagers Who Struggle To Survive

Until Dawn
7 /10
11
9.0 /10
Released
October 4, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Gamers who want to check out a playable version of a teen horror movie will likely love what Until Dawn brings to the table. The story follows a group of eight teenagers as they arrive at Blackwood Mountain for a party, but things end up going south for them pretty quickly.

All eight characters are playable and can be saved as long as players are smart about using the Butterfly Effect to their advantage. This is easier said than done, however, especially since the threat of the Wendigos can be so nerve-racking that players may slip up, causing one of the teenagers to die a brutal death.

3 Sunless Skies

Every Captain Can Die And Be Replaced By A New Protagonist

6 Images
6 Images
Sunless Skies
10.0 /10
Released
January 31, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Blood, Language, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

Sunless Skies is one of the best narrative-driven horror titles that gamers can enjoy. Those who enjoy the simple vibe of horror media over monsters being chucked in their faces will likely love the amazing atmospheric exploration available in this game, which is a huge step above its predecessor.

The combat is real-time and frenetic without being too frustrating, and the multiple hubs ensure that exploration remains fresh and engaging. Death can be a pain in this game, but players will continue as another captain who can live out a different story if they end up encountering it.

2 World Of Horror

Multiple Protagonists Can Be Controlled And Unlocked Throughout This Roguelike's Adventures

6 Images
6 Images
World of Horror
10.0 /10
Released
December 8, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Use of Alchohol and Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

World of Horror is a fun roguelike take on solving horror mysteries in a world where a Lovecraftian entity will destroy the town of Shiokawa and bring forth an apocalypse. That is unless players do something about it. The mysteries are far from straightforward, and players are recommended to check out an easier difficulty if they don't want to get frustrated early on.

Eventually, they'll unlock numerous protagonists with unique traits, allowing them to tackle each run in a distinct manner. Players may even settle into a rhythm as they make a habit of thwarting the apocalypse, giving them the confidence to bump up the difficulty and make things more challenging.

1 Omori

Both Sunny And Omori Are Different Yet Two Sides Of The Same Coin

OMORI
9.0 /10
Released
December 25, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

While it may be true that Omori and Sunny are two sides of the same coin, there are certain spoiler-heavy reasons why they may as well be different entities. The emotionally distant Sunny is clearly trying to repress his trauma and prefers to escape into Headspace, where he takes on the role of Omori instead.

However, as players will Sunny to confront his fears, Omori stands in his way as this separate entity starts taking control. Depending on what players choose, they can either succumb to Omori's influence or refuse to hide from their horrid actions as they finally take ownership of what they did.

item.title: Rumor: Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection Release Date Leaked
item.description:
The release date for Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection has seemingly leaked thanks to the Xbox mobile app, as keen-eyed fans pointed out that the anticipated compilation could come out on September 29. As of this writing, developer Digital Eclipse has not confirmed when Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection will hit store shelves, other than its previously listed 2025 release window.

Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection was first revealed during the June 4 State of Play broadcast, which highlighted several titles coming to PlayStation platforms. Digital Eclipse and Atari later confirmed that the compilation of classic Mortal Kombat titles would also be available on all major platforms, including the recently released Nintendo Switch 2. Multiple versions of titles like Mortal Kombat 2 and Ultimate Mortal Kombat 3 , including the arcade and console ports, will be part of the compilation. However, more classic Mortal Kombat titles will be revealed by Digital Eclipse closer to the Legacy Kollection 's launch.

While some questions surrounding Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection still linger, the game's release date may have accidentally been revealed by a surprising source. According to a thread on the GamingLeaksAndRumors subreddit by Reddit user ByrdOfMemes, Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection could arrive either on Monday, September 29, or Tuesday, September 30, depending on individual time zones. The OP replied with a screenshot seemingly taken from the Xbox mobile app, which showed September 29 as the compilation's supposed release date. Game Rant was able to verify this claim via the iOS version of the Xbox mobile app, with a screenshot taken at 9:38 PM Central on July 27. At the time of writing, the supposed September 29 release date for Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection was still listed on the app.

Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection Could Arrive In Late September

  • Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection could launch on September 29 or 30, depending on time zones.
  • The date was accidentally leaked by the Xbox mobile app's listing for the compilation.
  • However, no release dates were shown on Xbox's desktop site.
  • Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection will officially launch sometime in 2025.

However, the desktop version of the Xbox store does not have any precise release date information. While the release date would align with the 2025 window that Digital Eclipse previously mentioned, all rumors must be taken with a fine grain of salt. But, between the rumored July Nintendo Direct and the upcoming Evo 2025 fighting game championships taking place August 1-3 in Las Vegas, the release date for Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection could be confirmed over the next few days.

With playable fan favorites like Scorpion and Johnny Cage, and obscure combatants such as Shinnok, Drahmin, and Frost, Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection will feature a robust roster for players to peruse. Only time will tell when Digital Eclipse will officially confirm when Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection will be available.

6 Images

item.title: Should You Expose Nian Suichang or Remain Silent in Wuchang Fallen Feather?
item.description:
Nian Suichang is one of the first NPCs that players will meet on their way to the Shu Sanctum in Wuchang Fallen Feathers . After agreeing to help him retrieve the healing elixirs for his brother, it'll start Nian's questline, allowing you to interact with him in other major areas of the game. The next area you'll find Nian Suichang is on your way to Cloudspire. You'll retrieve a Tattered Pack for him, and then have an option to either expose him or remain silent. Here's what to do.

Where to Find Nian Suichang's Lost Equipment in Wuchang Fallen Feathers

On your way to the Cloudspire, players will reunite with Nian Suichang in Hillswatch in Wuchang Fallen Feathers . He'll be glad to see Wuchang again and tell her about the equipment that he's lost. It's important that you retrieve his equipment as failing to do so will end his questline prematurely.

To find Nian Suichang's equipment, players will have to head up the path and through the tunnel to arrive at the Snowy Passage . There will be a couple of enemies here, mostly farmers that aren't a threat, unless they start throwing rocks at you.

Keep heading up the path until you spot a soldier guarding the Snowy Passage . Make sure to eliminate the soldier first, before picking up the Tattered Pack from the ground near him. This pack contains Nian's lost equipment, so you should activate the shrine and head back to his location to hand it over.

Should you Expose Nian Suichang or Remain Silent in Wuchang Fallen Feathers?

Once players hand over the Tattered Pack to Nian Suichang, they'll have an option to either Expose him, or remain silent in Wuchang Fallen Feathers . This is a rather important choice as it decides whether you'll continue the questline or stop it in its tracks.

If players choose to expose Nian Suichang, he'll be taken aback and explain how he didn't mention the details of his travels to Wuchang before to avoid worrying her. After that, he'll reveal the location of General Ai Nengqi and ask Wuchang to summon him during the fight. Players will unlock the Sorry emote after this interaction, but Nian Suichang's questline can end with this option .

If you choose to remain silent, Nian Suichang will deliver a heroic monologue about how he will never turn a blind eye to a person in need. The rest of the interaction will go similarly to the previous choice, including you unlocking the Sorry emote. However, this choice will ensure that Nian Suichang's questline continues , and you see him in the next location.

8 Images
8 Images

item.title: Mass Effect: 8 Strongest Companions In The Series, Ranked
item.description:
This list contains spoilers!

Summary

  • Miranda excels in combat due to genetic perfection, but lacks absurdly strong abilities, making her strong but not invincible.
  • Garrus transitions from naive officer to deadly marksman, excelling in long-range combat and showing remarkable durability.
  • Jack's tragic past and biotic upgrades make her an unstoppable force, capable of causing immense carnage with her otherworldly powers.

There are many reasons why so many people have fallen in love with the Mass Effect series, but a big one is the lovable cast of companions that accompany Shepard in the games. When loading into a new mission, players will be able to pick two allies to bring with them on the adventure, and while they all have their own pros and cons, there are definitely some who are much stronger and more durable than others.

There have already been many online conversations discussing how likable and memorable many of these characters have become, but not as many in regards to their overall strength within the lore. When it comes to the world of Mass Effect, while physical strength is one thing, a person's biotic abilities and augmentations can also help to give them an advantage in combat, so it can take much more than just being a giant brute to be considered strong in this fascinating universe.

8 Miranda

Miranda Was Designed to Handle Any Kind Of Combat Scenario

  • Race: Human
  • Affiliation: Cerberus

On the surface, Miranda can seem like a crude and cold-hearted agent of Cerberus who cares little for the well-being of others, but there's a specific reason why she turned out this way. Miranda was created by her father to be genetically perfect, with everything from her biotic powers to her firearm expertise, all the way to her appearance being designed in a way to make her the ideal loyal servant for the Illusive Man.

As a result of this, Miranda has demonstrated on numerous occasions that she is more than capable of holding her own, such as at the beginning of Mass Effect 2 , where she held off a swarm of robots off-screen without picking up a single scratch. Still, Miranda doesn't have any absurdly strong abilities hidden away up her sleeves that she can throw out when things get dangerous, and she's also still as fragile as the average human, so while she's definitely strong, she's far from invincible.

7 Garrus

Shepard's Most Loyal Companion Can Take A Lot Of Punishment While Dishing Out Plenty Of Damage

  • Race: Turian
  • Affiliation: C-Sec Officer / Mercenary

When players first meet Garrus in the first Mass Effect game, he comes across as a fairly naive officer who is clearly wasting his potential by being stuck on the Citadel. However, after he breaks away from the red tape that was holding him down for so long, he then becomes Archangel, a deadly marksman who spends his days picking off criminals and thugs from afar with a deadly sniper rifle. Like many Turians, Garrus may not be the most effective combatant in close combat scenarios, but from a range, he can easily eliminate any targets that Shepard points him to.

What also contributes to making Garrus so strong is his durability. In Mass Effect 2 , Garrus takes a barrage of bullets from a helicopter, only to then come back hours later to continue the mission, despite half of his face being completely scorched. This means he is able to dish out consistent damage without being taken down in the middle of battle, and of course, who could forget his devastating Concussive Shot, and ability that many Mass Effect fans have relied on to get them out of a tricky firefight or two.

6 Grunt

Even A Young Krogan Can Still Wreak Plenty Of Havoc

  • Race: Krogan
  • Affiliation: Shepard's Crew

Though Grunt is still technically a baby, the fact that he has Krogan blood running through his veins inherently makes him an absolute powerhouse, something he makes very clear when gripping Shepard up against the wall after Grunt is first released from his pod. Designed to become the perfect super soldier of the Krogan, Grunt is able to not only blast his enemies to pieces with shotguns and rockets, but he's also not shy about tearing apart his enemies limb from limb with his own physical strength.

That being said, though, most of the time, he simply prefers charging in head-first to deal with as many enemies as possible in one lethal swoop. The main drawback to Grunt's power is his inexperience, since it can still be hard for him to know how to effectively use his underlying strength rather than waste it, but his lineage still makes him one of the strongest companions Shepard has ever had.

5 Thane

An Assassin Who Can Take Out His Opponents In The Blink Of An Eye

  • Race: Drell
  • Affiliation: Mercenary

The Drell are very rarely seen throughout the Mass Effect series, with the most notable among them being Thane. As an assassin who has been eliminating criminals and thugs for many years of his life, Thane is a master assassin who is able to kill his target before they even see him coming. There aren't many people in Mass Effect who are able to keep up with Thane when it comes to hand-to-hand combat, but that's not his only area of expertise.

Thane is also capable of using a wide array of weapons, from handguns to SMGs, all the way to sniper rifles. He even possesses a few biotic abilities that can help him fend off enemies who try to overwhelm him. He might not fare very well when taking on a group of enemies by himself, but in one-on-one scenarios, Thane is as deadly as they come.

4 Javik

Javik Uses His Immensely Powerful Prothean Abilities To Assist Shepard In Mass Effect 3

  • Race: Prothean
  • Affiliation: Prothean Resistance Leader

While the Protheans are incredibly important to the lore of Mass Effect , considering they were previously wiped out by the Reapers and acquired technology which could be used to beat them, they were never actually seen in the flesh until the third game. Javik was the leader of the Prothean rebellion back when the Reapers first invaded, which already gives an indication as to how strong this guy truly is.

What really takes him to a whole new level, though, is the Prothean abilities, which he is able to use in combat. A prime example of this is Dark Channel, a black void that can destroy enemies from the inside out and can even spread between targets while it's being used. He also has a will of steel and is adept at using a variety of firearms, making him an extremely valuable ally not only because of his knowledge, but also his strength.

3 Wrex

Wrex Only Unleashed His True Power When Absolutely Necessary

  • Race: Krogan
  • Affiliation: Clan Urdnot

Wrex is a Krogan who strives to change the perception of his people, while also leading them to a more peaceful way of life by resisting their temptation to inflict war and chaos wherever they go. That being said though, as a warrior who has being fighting for his cause for more than 700 years, it's no exaggeration to say that Wrex has been through hell and back multiple times, so while he may seem like a pacifist, he is still more than happy to cut someone down to size if they get on his bad side.

Alongside his physical prowess, Wrex is even able to use a few biotic powers to help him out in combat, and considering how often he charges into a chaotic fight headfirst, it's also safe to say that taking him down in combat can seem more or less impossible for his victims.

2 Samara

A Justicar Who Possesses An Arsenal Of Mind-Bending Biotic Abilities And Powers

  • Race: Asari
  • Affiliation: Justicar

Samara isn't just any random Asari; she's a Justicar warrior who has dedicated her entire life to enacting justice in the universe by any means necessary. While Asari are already known for being skilled at using biotic powers, Samara takes this to a whole new level, being able to slam her enemies against walls with a single motion of her hand. Samara has been honing her skills for multiple centuries, which is why she is considered such a dangerous threat when Shepherd runs into her in Mass Effect 2 .

It heavily implied that if Samara were ever to go rogue and abandon her position, she would be virtually unstoppable given the caliber of her powers. Samara is also able to use her biotic abilities to protect herself through the use of shields, making her both an effective damage dealer and a defensive tank. Thankfully, Samara never unleashes her true strength without a justifiable reason, deciding to become an ally to Shepard so that she could seek out her daughter, and also stop the threat of the Collectors.

1 Jack

Jack Was Made Into A Biotic Monster By Cerberus, Granting Her Otherwordly Powers

  • Race: Human
  • Affiliation: Nobody

When Shepard is tasked with recruiting Jack from the Purgatory Prison, he is warned right off the bat that this is going to be a highly dangerous mission, as Jack is known for being unpredictable. However, nobody could have expected just how much carnage Jack would truly be capable of causing. Due to being experimented on against her will by Cerberus at a young age, Jack is a human who possesses an arsenal of upgraded biotic abilities, which make it difficult to even get close to her, let alone deal any damage.

When Jack breaks out of her pod, she obliterates the entire prison single-handedly, tossing prison guards around like ragdolls and flattening mechs without even breaking a sweat. Jack's tragic childhood and underlying rage have also made her more than happy to inflict as much damage as possible on her enemies, allowing her to maximize the potential of her biotic powers to crush anyone who stands in her way. Even Shepard, who had previously taken down an entire Reaper, seemed a little hesitant when first meeting Jack, which gives a good idea of how insanely strong this companion is, being undoubtedly the most powerful in the series.

Your comment has not been saved

Follow
Followed
Mass Effect: Legendary Edition
Action
RPG
